bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 207 (Wednesday, December 1, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. KELLY of Illinois:H.R. 6108.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Section 8 of Article 1 of the Constitution[Page H6859]

item.title: Community College to Career Fund in Higher Education Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

summary.text:
Community College to Career Fund in Higher Education Act

This bill requires the Department of Education and the Department of Labor to award grants to institutions of higher education for education and workforce training programs or related activities. Such programs or activities must lead to or expand opportunities for students to obtain recognized postsecondary credentials (e.g., associate degrees or industry-recognized certifications).

bill.title: Community College to Career Fund in Higher Education Act

item.title: Community College to Career Fund in Higher Education Act
Community College to Career Fund in Higher Education Act
To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to support community college and industry partnerships, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
